pr_title: Set commit author to the workflow triggering user for Jib CLI release

timeline.message: Set commit author to the triggering user

timeline.bodyText: why this? is it because the github user no longer auto triggers a kokoro run?
timeline.author: loosebazooka
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -53,7 +52,8 @@ jobs:
           source_branch: cli-release-v${{ github.event.inputs.release_version }}
           pr_title: "CLI release v${{ github.event.inputs.release_version }}"
           pr_body: "To be merged after the release is complete."
-    
+          pr_label: "kokoro:run"

replies.bodyText: I thought github emails associated with our accounts would still trigger kokoro?
replies.author: loosebazooka

replies.bodyText: I don't know why, but <github user>@users.noreply.github.com as a PR author (as opposed to @google.com) doesn't trigger Kokoro (at least in my case). I also tried manually associating the email to my GitHub account on the settings page (the settings email page doesn't display the email in the list), but of course, it complains that the email is already in use. Maybe this should be configured on the Kokoro side?
replies.author: chanseokoh
